titleStmt.title: An entry from the Journals of Hensley Henson

sourceDesc.bibl: Edited from the manuscripts in the custody of Durham Cathedral Library.

body.p: I wrote a "Golden Lecture" for next Tuesday: and walked with Beeching as far as the London Library. After lunch I wrote letters & revised my address on "The New Testament in the State schools". At 4 p.m. I delivered the Address in S. Margaret's to an assembly which, considering the remarkable fineness of the day which almost compelled flight into the open air, showed no falling off in public interest. The "Times" man again carried off my MS: & to a "Yorkshire Post" man, who sought for farther knowledge of my educational views, I gave a copy of my Letter on 'Religious Education'.
